intro: Lomaria paucijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomaria, is a perennial herb native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 5,000 meters. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it blooms during the summer months. Lomaria paucijuga is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
